title: "you have disconnected, please check your internet connection and try again"
body:
2 months ago, before the update, I played League of Legends, without issues, no lags, no connection problems, nothing.... 
After the last update, connection problem started: "You have disconnected, please check your internet connection and try again", even tho I have 30 - 50 mbs consistant connection, it happens again.. 
Other games I play without connection problems, all smooth 
I tried everything: hextech repair tool, changing windows firewall options, clean reinstall, EVERYTHING! 
I've even tried to see if there's problem with my wireless USB, tried configuring windows settings, NOTHING WORKED! 
If you have any solution to this please help, i really want to play League of Legends like I used to, not to be late 3 minutes in the game.. 
Champion select goes smooth, no problem, but in the loading screen i connect 60 or 80%, and then the message pops up: "You have disconnected, please check your internet connection and try again", and i need to wait till game starts... 
What is even worse I can't even use practice tool, which i need to be able to practice champs.. 
As i said i tried everything, nothing worked 
If you have solution for this problem, please help...

THANK YOU!

replies.body:
There are a few different things happening on that loading screen like loading game assets, making new connections with the game server you're being placed on, as well as League needing access to certain files. Since so much is happening, there's also a number of different things that could go wrong obviously like game assets not loading or firewalls/antivirus blocking League from working properly. 

Do me a favor and run a quick repair through the client settings, since crashing at the same percentage kind of makes me think it might be some damaged or missing game files. If that doesn't help right off the bat, go ahead and run through the other steps in this [**crash guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974) as well just to cover the rest of the basics. Make sure to test these tips in a practice or custom game to avoid getting any possible LPQ's for more crashes!

https://i.imgur.com/4a1AwZa.png

Thanks for the 5 games in low priority que Riot. I can safely say 100% it is not on my end. Played your game for 8 years without this problem.

I'm currently in a low priority queue thanks to this, pretty mad about it since it's not my fault; my internet is fine according to speed tests. For whatever reason, it seems to usually be the _first_ game of the day I play that happens to disconnect; the following two or three are generally not interrupted with any connection issues.
